licensing: Do not copy proprietary text; author original summaries.
privacy: Do not include secrets or personal data in escalation records.
safety: Do not overwrite existing escalation records.
Reject context and session_id values containing path separators or dot-segments.

acceptance_criteria: Creates an escalation record under runtime/contexts/<context>/escalations/.
Increments escalation counters deterministically per session.
Logs a U.Work record when telemetry/log-work is available.

failure_modes: Invalid context or session_id value (not a safe path segment).
Failed to write the escalation record file.

inputs.description: Bounded context name used to locate runtime/contexts/<context> (must be a safe path segment).
inputs.name: context

inputs.description: Session identifier for the escalation (safe path segment).
inputs.name: session_id

inputs.description: Optional requested by label (role or person).
inputs.name: requested_by

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of related artifact paths.
inputs.name: artifacts

inputs.description: Optional RoleAssignment label used when logging U.Work (default: Strategist).
inputs.name: role_assignment

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of related DRR ids or paths.
inputs.name: decisions

inputs.description: Optional ISO-8601 timestamp_start override (used for deterministic testing).
inputs.name: timestamp_start

intent.goal: Escalate a session issue to a human reviewer with a structured record.
non_goals: Does not approve or deny requests.

name: Escalate to Human

outputs.description: Path to the generated escalation record markdown file.
outputs.name: escalation_record_path

procedure.instruction: Validate required inputs (context, session_id, reason) and ensure safe path segments.
Compute the next escalation index for the session.
Write the escalation record with status open and capture context details.
If telemetry/log-work is available, log the escalation with agent metadata when provided.

summary: Escalates a session issue to a human reviewer.
